UP Board exam 2026 pre-board schedule released; exams from January 8 to 21
description: The UP Board has released the pre-board schedule for 2026, with exams for Class 10 and 12 students running from January 8 to 21. All government, aided, and unaided schools will follow the same timetable. Schools must complete the syllabus, conduct written and practical exams, and upload internal assessment marks. Pre-board exams provide students a realistic experience of the main board exams. Practical exams will be held in two phases, and the main exams start February 18.

title: AI debate: Mathematician Joel Hamkins warns; ‘LLMs give wrong answers’
description: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.
